title: Career & Business
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing professional development, workplace dynamics, and business operations.

words.meaning: advancement to a higher position or rank
words.example: She earned a promotion after leading the successful project.

words.meaning: dismissal from a job because the position is no longer needed
words.example: The company announced 200 redundancies due to restructuring.

words.meaning: a person who starts and runs their own business
words.example: The young entrepreneur founded three successful startups.

words.meaning: income generated from business operations
words.example: Annual revenue increased by 15% compared to last year.

words.meaning: a person with an interest or concern in a business
words.example: All stakeholders were consulted before making the decision.

words.meaning: the time by which something must be completed
words.example: We need to meet the deadline for the quarterly report.

words.meaning: building professional relationships and contacts
words.example: Networking events are great for career development.

words.meaning: the combining of two companies into one
words.example: The merger created the largest tech company in the region.

words.meaning: having a strong desire for success or achievement
words.example: She's an ambitious professional who aims to become CEO.

words.meaning: having the necessary skill or knowledge
words.example: A competent manager knows how to motivate their team.

words.meaning: producing financial gain
words.example: The venture became profitable within its first year.

words.meaning: introducing new ideas or methods
words.example: Their innovative approach disrupted the entire industry.

words.meaning: able to continue over a long period
words.example: The company focuses on sustainable business practices.

words.meaning: relating to long-term plans for success
words.example: Strategic planning is essential for company growth.

words.meaning: relating to a large company or group
words.example: Corporate culture varies greatly between companies.

words.meaning: to discuss something to reach an agreement
words.example: She negotiated a higher salary during the interview.

words.meaning: to assign tasks or responsibilities to others
words.example: Good leaders know when to delegate tasks.

words.meaning: to work jointly with others
words.example: Teams from different departments collaborate on projects.

words.meaning: to put a plan or decision into effect
words.example: The company will implement the new policy next month.

words.meaning: to voluntarily leave a job or position
words.example: He decided to resign and pursue other opportunities.

words.meaning: something that motivates or encourages action
words.example: Performance bonuses serve as incentives for employees.

words.meaning: the rate of output per unit of input
words.example: Remote work has improved productivity for many employees.

words.meaning: the rate at which employees leave and are replaced
words.example: High turnover rates indicate low job satisfaction.

words.meaning: a system of ranking people by authority level
words.example: The company has a flat hierarchy with few management levels.

words.meaning: to contract work out to external suppliers
words.example: Many companies outsource their IT support.

words.meaning: a standard against which things are compared
words.example: This company sets the benchmark for customer service.

words.meaning: possible and practical to achieve
words.example: We need to determine if the project is feasible.

words.meaning: open and honest, without hidden agendas
words.example: Transparent communication builds trust in teams.

words.meaning: the act of buying or obtaining something, especially a company
words.example: The acquisition of the startup expanded their market share.

words.meaning: to expand into different areas or markets
words.example: The company decided to diversify its product range.

exercises.instruction: Match the words with their definitions

pairs.definition: dismissal from a job because the position is no longer needed
a person with an interest in a business
the combining of two companies into one

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the correct words

sentences.sentence: She received a _____ to senior manager after five years.
Good managers know how to _____ with employees during salary reviews.
The company's annual _____ exceeded expectations this quarter.
It's important to set realistic _____ for project completion.

exercises.instruction: Choose the best word to complete each sentence

questions.question: The company needs to _____ its operations to remain competitive.
High employee _____ can be costly for organizations.
